action.action-desc: Mr. Perry introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Appropriations, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit Federal funding for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Propaganda Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funds for Corporation for Public Broadcasting

subsection.text: Section 396 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
No Federal funds may be made available to the Corporation after the date of the enactment of the No Propaganda Act.

subsection.header: Corporation prohibited from accepting Federal funds
subsection.text: Section 396(g) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396(g)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A), by inserting subject to paragraph (3)(C), before obtain; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
accepting funds from the Federal Government after the date of the enactment of the No Propaganda Act.

subsection.text: Any unobligated balances of amounts made available under the heading Corporation for Public Broadcasting in the Further Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2020 (Public Law 116–94; 133 Stat. 2600) or the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 (Public Law 116–260) are hereby rescinded.

Section 396(k)(3)(A)(iv)(II) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396(k)(3)(A)(iv)(II)) is amended by inserting before the date of the enactment of the No Propaganda Act after amounts received.
